|   71468058 | Studio BA1                                                                                              | AR-101       | The semester focuses on the tools and processes of architectural research and making through direct encounters with spatial problems. Through these encounters, students will approach space, site as a physical context where architecture can occur, and the relation of the two to their own body.                                                                      | 2016-2017    |
|   71468058 | Studio BA2                                                                                              | AR-102       | Semester 2 provides a laboratory condition in which students refine tools of architectural research and making with the aim of realizing an architectural project that deals with space, construction and program within an architectonic discourse.                                                                                                                                     | 2016-2017    |

|    1773962 | History of architecture I                                                                               | AR-123       | Contemporary architecture is heir to 5,000 years of accumulated experience, whose genesis lies in the Eastern Mediterranean. |    2978058 | Stereotomy                                                                                              | AR-211       | In the history of architecture, stereotomy is the art of designing and manufacturing complex volumes in 3 dimensions for vaults in stone or wooden bents. This course proposes a contemporary reinterpretation of stereotomy with digitals tools.                                                                                                                                        | 2016-2017    |
